title: Field Guide on Reef Associated Fishes of India

features: Adults are yellowish-brown with dark brown spots.
Juveniles have a zebra-like pattern of stripes.
Possesses a very long caudal fin and prominent body ridges.
Spiracles are subequal in size to the eyes.
Greyish-brown coloration, sometimes with faint bands.
Body is covered with dark spots and transverse bands.
Long tail, nearly the length of the body.
Conspicuous black markings on the tips of all fins.
Presence of white dots at the base of the disc.
Leopard-like pattern of rings and spots.
Bright blue spots on the disc.
Broad flap of skin on the tail.
Dark dorsal surface with white spots.
Elongated head, lacks spots of A. narinari.
Transverse blue lines across the back.
White body with dark brown or black bands.
Yellow or green margin on the fins.
Body is brownish with dark speckles.
Eel-like body with 2-3 pale horizontal stripes.
Pectoral fin does not reach the dorsal-fin origin.
Banded pattern on the tail fin.
Series of dark blotches along the lateral line.
Variegated pattern of reddish bars and blotches.
Anal-fin base is much longer than the dorsal-fin base.
Globular body with elongate pectoral-fin lobes.
Variable color, often with patches and spots.
Distinct brown spot near the dorsal fin.
Covered in membranous fringes for camouflage.
Prominent silvery band along the side.
Elongated lower jaw forming a beak.
Silvery body with beak-like lower jaw.
Both jaws elongated with sharp teeth.
Large eyes and mucous cavities on head.
Black edges on dorsal and caudal fins.
Single tooth patch on lower jaw.
Black tip on spinous dorsal fin.

Reddish-black blotch on spinous dorsal fin.

Red to orange-brown above, silvery below.
Blue stripes and spots on body.
1st dorsal-fin spine is long and sharp.

Blotch between 8-14 spines of dorsal fin.
Spots in a line on caudal fin.
Large head relative to body size.
Black tip on some fin rays.
Large spots on upper half of pectoral fin.
Black spots on soft dorsal, caudal and anal fins.
Lowermost pectoral ray is completely free.
Anal fin with 2 spines and 12-15 soft rays.
Inside of mouth and gill cavity are reddish-orange.
Body is dark brown to black.
Covered in small, bright blue spots.
White to bluish spots on head and body.
Small dark blue spots on snout, lips, and ventral part of head and chest.
Bright orange-red body covered in small blue spots.
No spots on underside of lower jaw.
Purple network pattern on head, maxilla and lips.
Head profile straight to concave in adults.
Dark brown body with small orange-yellowish spots.
Usually 2 dark spots on edge of lower lip.
Six dark blotches on the back.
Body covered in small blue spots.
Spotted first ray of caudal fin.
Posterior nostril is a large vertical slit.
Body is pale with large, dark, round spots.
Golden tips on the dorsal spines.
Dark spots subequal to pupil size.
Caudal fin is truncate with a white edge.
Upper half of body is spotted.
Lower part of caudal fin is dusky.
Three faint bars on the back.
Largest spots are smaller than the pupil.
Slightly concave caudal fin with a white margin.
5 faint irregular dark bars on body.
Usually 5 dark vertical bars broader than interspaces.
Posterior nostril is a large vertical slit.
A black triangle on inter-spinous membranes of dorsal fin.
Whitish base color with darker spots on fins.
Spots at base of dorsal fin.
Body is dark grey to blue, fins are bright yellow.

Dark saddle blotch on caudal peduncle.
Body has a marbled pattern of dark blotches.
Fins with numerous small black spots.
Very large size; juveniles are yellow and black.
Three spotted horizontal lines on body.
Reddish-brown spots that are elongated and darker posteriorly.
5 irregular dark brown bars on body.
Single large black blotch in the middle of the dorsal fin base.

Small brown spots and a white reticulated pattern.
Banding pattern of dark brown bars.
Small close-set spots on the body.
Large brownish spots on soft portion of fins.
Body has wavy, pale blue or white lines.
Dark blotch on back not joined to lower band.
Small dark spots and irregular blotches for camouflage.

3 large black blotches (saddles) on the back.
Body covered in small brown spots.
Elongate body covered in faint, dusky spots.
Wavy brown lines on a paler background.
Prominent knob on ventral edge of maxilla in adults.
Small blue spots on a red base.
Has two color phases: white with large brown saddles, or dark brown/red.
Thick blue outer ring around the eye.
Body is reddish-brown with numerous small blue spots.
Distinctive color pattern with pink, orange, and yellow.
Yellow coloration on back and tail.
Thin white edge on the lunate tail.

Pelvic fins of adults reach the anus.

Large eyes, typical of the family.
Black tip on first dorsal fin.

Deeply compressed body, similar to A. ciliaris.

Dark bars or saddles on the back.
